question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Joseph Marie Régis Belzile hold in 2035?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1: In the quaint town of Mouscron, nestled in the French-speaking region of Belgium, a remarkable individual was born on April 15, 1931. Joseph Marie Régis Belzile, a Canadian priest, would go on to leave an indelible mark on the Catholic Church. As we delve into the life and accomplishments of Bishop Belzile, it becomes evident that he indeed holds the esteemed position of diocesan bishop. Growing up in a devout Catholic family, Belzile was drawn to the priesthood from a young age. He pursued his calling, enrolling in the Grand Séminaire de Montréal, where he studied theology and philosophy. After completing his studies, Belzile was ordained as a priest on May 24, 1956, by Archbishop Paul-Émile Léger. This marked the beginning of his illustrious career in the Catholic Church. As a priest, Belzile demonstrated exceptional dedication and leadership skills, which did not go unnoticed by the Church hierarchy. In 1977, Pope Paul VI appointed him as the Auxiliary Bishop of Ottawa, a position that would serve as a stepping stone to greater responsibilities. This appointment not only recognized Belzile's capabilities but also underscored his potential to assume a more prominent role in the Church. The turning point in Belzile's career came on April 30, 1992, when Pope John Paul II appointed him as the Bishop of Mouscron, a diocese located in the province of Hainaut, Belgium. This appointment was a testament to Belzile's exceptional leadership skills, his ability to navigate complex ecclesiastical matters, and his deep understanding of the Catholic faith. As the diocesan bishop of Mouscron, Belzile was entrusted with the pastoral care of the diocese, overseeing the spiritual well-being of the faithful, guiding the clergy, and managing the diocese's administrative affairs. He worked tirelessly to promote ecumenism, foster dialogue with other Christian denominations, and address the social concerns of the community. One of Belzile's most notable achievements as diocesan bishop was his efforts to revitalize the Catholic Church in Mouscron. He implemented innovative programs to increase vocations, encouraged lay involvement in Church affairs, and worked to strengthen the bonds between the clergy and the laity. His dedication to the diocese earned him the respect and admiration of the people, who came to regard him as a compassionate and visionary leader.

Here is a potential Wikipedia entry for Joseph Marie Régis Belzile:

Joseph Marie Régis Belzile

Joseph Marie Régis Belzile (born 1965) is a Canadian priest who served as the General Secretary of the Prefecture of Drôme in France from January 2030 to February 2032. Early Life and Education

Belzile was born in Quebec, Canada, in 1965. He was raised in a devout Catholic family and felt a calling to the priesthood from a young age. He attended the Grand Séminaire de Montréal, where he earned a degree in theology and was ordained as a priest in 1992. Career

After his ordination, Belzile served as a parish priest in several communities in Quebec. In 2005, he was appointed as the Vicar General of the Archdiocese of Montreal, where he served until 2015. In 2015, Belzile was appointed as the Attaché for Religious Affairs at the Canadian Embassy to France, where he served until 2029. During his time in France, he developed a deep understanding of the French government and its administrative structures. General Secretary of the Prefecture of Drôme

In January 2030, Belzile was appointed as the General Secretary of the Prefecture of Drôme, a position he held until February 2032. During his tenure, he worked closely with the Prefect of Drôme to implement policies and programs aimed at promoting economic development and social cohesion in the region. Under Belzile's leadership, the Prefecture of Drôme launched several initiatives aimed at supporting local businesses and promoting tourism in the region. He also worked to strengthen ties between the Prefecture and local religious communities, recognizing the important role that faith plays in the lives of many Drôme residents. References
